Text: There is something going on outside.
Alexia opens her eyes for the first time in hours.

The only ones who ever enter the room are a female
caretaker and the man in the white coat,

which gives Alexia nothing to do except sleep on the
same table that binds her hands and feet.

Neither Alexia nor the creature bother the other,
which means they are getting along all right.

The clamor intensifies, indicating there's some kind
of conflict beyond this room.
Bet you also can't sleep with all the noise.

But I think it's best to stay awake. You don't want
to miss out on the fun.

Alexia knows it won't answer her, but she talks to it
anyway.
Boredom can have strange effects on the mind.

It takes a while before the sound of a key unlocking
the door echoes throughout the room in a flustered
and apprehensive way.
Damn it, damn it, damn it!
The man in the white coat barrels into the room.

Those bastards... They're here! This is the end...
Th-They'll kill us all!

The Knight Order won't kill needlessly. If you
surrender now, I'm sure they'll spare your life.
"Or they won't," she adds silently.

The Knight Order? I don't give a damn about them!
Th-The fiends will kill everyone. Everyone, I tell
you!
Huh...?

Then who? Alexia can't imagine anyone else. But then
again, she knows it's completely possible he's gone
nuts.

The man in the white coat claws at his head and
shifts his gaze toward the creature.

I-I've made a prototype. I-If I use this, even a
worthless creature like you might be useful.

He pushes the device with the syringe into the
creature's arm.

You shouldn't do that. I don't have a good feeling
about this.
Alexia warns, sounding quite serious.

But he obviously just ignores her, shoving the needle
in its arm and injecting it with an unknown fluid.
Behold! I give you a glimpse of Diablos!

The creature begins swelling, its muscles bulging
before their eyes, and even its skeletal structure
starts to expand.

Its right arm, which was long and thick, morphs into
a malicious and ominous form. Its fingertips sprout
nails as long as human legs.

Its left arm appears to be holding something and
stays stuck to its body.
I-Incredible... Astounding!!!

But the chains cannot endure the rapid growth of the
creature and snap off on their own.
And then...
Splat.

The man in the white coat isn't even spared a final
scream of agony before he's crushed by its right arm.
I told you it was a bad idea.

Alexia and the creature lock eyes. She studies its
movements.
Well, then.

Her hands and feet are bound, which means there isn't
much she can do.

But she can move around a little bit. Plus, she can't
stand the thought of dying as a consequence of some
idiot's mistake.
The creature swings its right arm.
You...!

It avoids Alexia and pulverizes the table that binds
her.
Did you...really free me...?
The creature emits a high-pitched shriek
and crashes through the stone wall.

Piles of trampled soldiers litter the long, dimly lit
hallway.

Alexia swipes the keys from one of the crushed
knights.
Just my bad luck...
The creature is gone,

leaving behind a shattered table and a demolished
wall.
...Well, maybe not.
She removes her magical restraints.
Could be worse.
Now her magic can flow free.
I'll be taking that.

Alexia borrows a mithril sword from a corpse. It's
flimsy, but it'll get the job done.

She stretches once to loosen up, then heads through
the wall the creature destroyed.

When she goes down the hallway and turns the
corner...
We can't have you leaving on your own.
...a familiar face appears before her.
Y-You... Why are you here?
Alexia's eyes widen in astonishment.

Confidence overflows from the smile stretched across
the face of a dashing blond. It's Zenon Griffey.

Because this is my facility, that's why. I invested
a lot of zeni into that man. That's all there is to
it.
Ahh...!
...That's nice to know.
I always thought you were messed up in the head.
I guess I was right.

Think whatever you want. But I don't mind as long as
I have your blood.
All anyone talks about around here is blood.

With my research and your blood, I'm destined to
receive the twelfth seat in the Rounds. I shall bid
farewell to my meaningless position as an instructor.
The Rounds? Is that a group for lunatics?

The Knights of Rounds is a gathering of twelve
superior knights from my religion. It will bring me
greater wealth and fame than I've ever known.

I would have preferred Princess Iris, but it looks
like I'll have to settle for you.

A forceful swing from Alexia's sword signals the
start of their battle. She goes straight for the
jugular.

Oh, excuse me. I forgot you hate being compared to
your sister.
Grr...!
Sparks fly from the colliding blades.

Judging this skirmish merely by the manner in which
their swords dance in the air, one might be inclined
to say their skills are equally matched.

But the sword bearers wear very different expressions.
Alexia angrily glowers whereas Zenon has a relaxed
smile.
You've improved. But you're still mediocre.
Alexia visibly contorts her face.

For a moment, it looks as if her urge to cry is
drowned out by pure fury.

Alexia knows. She knows full well she isn't strong
enough to beat Zenon, and her flimsy weapon won't
last long.

But Alexia hasn't spent all those days training with
her head in the clouds. In her mission to become as
strong as her sister, she's realized her own short-
comings and worked hard to make up for them.

She's observed her sister's swordplay more than
anyone else.
Just watch me.
Then you can say if you really think I'm mediocre!!!

With that, she lunges at him with all the energy she
can muster.
It's a stroke reminiscent of her sister's assaults.

Alexia can picture every move of her sister's
swordplay with impeccable accuracy.
Huh?!
For the first time, Zenon's smile vanishes.

...Your sister's swordplay. I had no idea you were
hiding your strength.
There's more where that came from.

In that case, let me show you the skills of the next
generation of the Rounds!
Zenon readies his sword.
Grr...!
Haaaah!!!

Alexia has never seen an attack with so much power
lurking behind it.

Their skills are as hopelessly different as a genius
and a clod.
He may even rival her older sister.
Looking back...

Alexia's childhood memories resurface in her mind of
times when swinging her sword brought nothing but
pure joy.
Her sister was always beside her.

This is a distant memory that should have faded long
ago.
*Gasp*
You'll never be as good as your sister.
You're coming with me.
A single tear falls from Alexia's eye.
Just then—
A sound erupts from the stairwell behind Zenon.
The one clad in ebony...
The noise ceases...
My name is Shadow.
I lurk in the darkness and hunt down shadows...
There stands a man in a long ebony coat.
